column5: National Arts Council of South Africa (NAC)
column6: Executive Search Recruitment Service
column8:
The initial RFQ request was for the advert for the position to be placed on various print
media i.e. one weekday newspaper and the other Sunday newspaper. Ebus Tech
Consulting quoted as per the original request However, the internal committee resolved that
only one (1) print media be utilised, and the position should be advertised on a Sunday
newspaper for two (2) consecutive Sundays. The reason is to ensure that the advertised
vacancies reach a broader spectrum. The quote received from the service provider will cover
two (2) publications (Rapport and City Press Career) section, which is a Combo at the total
cost of R128 064.00. The additional requirement exceeds the 10% contingency fee
originally catered for.

SAWS best financial interest to request an extension for the Alcatel LAN contract to acquire

lease agreement might be fruitless expenditure seeing that ICT will have to procure this
service from a new service provider for the new building (continuity of service)

column6: Rental of 26 Laptops
column8:
Awaiting procurement of bulk laptops process to be finalised: Tender advertised- closing
July 2023. The rental of laptops were initially procured to replace stolen equipment after
office burglary. The matter was reported to the SAPS and insurance claim was filed. The
insurere rejected the claim and the RFQ process in the interim, failed to yield positive
responses. The reason for variation for 2 months is to minimize impact on daily business
operations and allow the procurement process to be finalised.

Manufacturing, Engineering and Related Services
Sector Education and Training Authority
(merSETA)SETA
column6: Additional resource for legal assistance
column8:
The merSETA appointed Motsoeneng Bill Attorneys from merSETA’s panel of
attorneys to provide legal assistance to the merSETA on the Khumalo and Mabuya
Chartered Accountants Forensic Investigation Report. Due to the volume of work and the
urgent matters at hand that require prompt attendance and conclusion regarding the
outcome of the investigation report, approval was obtained requested for an additional
resource to work jointly with the appointed provider.

Manufacturing, Engineering and Related Services
Sector Education and Training Authority
(merSETA)SETA
column6: Office accommodation - lease extension
column8:
Several tender adverts failed to yield any positive responses. An extension from 01 Oct 2022
to 31 March 2023 was duly approved in accordance with National Treasury Instruction No.3
of 2021/2022 while the new tender process is underway. A further extension from 01 Aug
2023 to 31 Oct 2023 was duly approved by the Accounting Officer as the previous tender
was non responsive. Recent tender advertised - closed on 14 Jul'23 - only 1 (one) bid
received. To be evaluated by mid-August 2023.

column6:
iLAB-PO000006575, supply and installation of filters, and
validations of cleanrooms by Filta Matix Pty Ltd
column8:
Filta-Matix was appointed to perform validations (iLAB-PO000006575) and they provided a
report with findings. The Nuclear Medicine Department requests that Filta-Matix be
appointed to attend to the findings so that the cleanroom can be compliant. Should another
bidder be appointed to correct the findings, they will need to perform their own validations
and provide their own findings, this will be additional costs. The expenditure incurred on the
works performed by Filta-Matix will then be deemed fruitless and wasteful expenditure.

column8:
Continuation of service-SAWS was advised to submit the formal proposal to be taken
through to Emthanjeni Local Municipality Council for consideration. The lease agreement is
coming to an end on 31 August 2023, SAWS proposal must undergo different stages prior
to approval; it should be noted that the timing might not be in SAWS’s favor to extend the
lease agreement and avoid incurring irregular expenditure should the existing lease
agreement terminate before receiving a formal outcome from the Emthanjeni Local
Municipality Council

column6:
Provision of Install, Configure, Implement and Maintain a
Digital Signature Solution for a Period of 24 Months
column8:
The Department appointed Exponant (Pty) Ltd through RFQ procurement processes and all
suppliers were sourced through CSD database, to assist the DSBD with Electronic
SigniFlow licenses for 102 employees. During the year the DSBD establishment have
increased and addition number of 32 SigniFlow licences access is required. The addition 32
licenses is amount covered within in line with Instruction Note 3 of 2021/2022 section 5.1
(a) the AO/AA may in accordance with this paragraph expand a contract by increasing the
scope of work and 5.4 (b), 5.5 of the same Instruction note if contract for all other goods or
services or both, is expended or varied but more that 15% or R 15 million (including all
applicable taxes), whichever is the lesser.

column6:
Provision of Maintenance Repairs, Upgrade and Supply of
Spares on Schindler Lift for 36 months
column8:
Time extension and Funds request ,The extension is requested for the modification of the
contract because we need to perform monthly statutory lift maintenance and services, the
procurement process has not started because we still need to get the sole source form to be
approved because the old national sole source form has expired. The lift will be used for
personnel at Komati Power Station to move between levels. The purchase requisition has
been created on SAP system to establish a new contract for lift maintenance as soon as the
sole source form has been approved a PR will be released to the procurement manager to
continue procuring the services. If this contract is not extended the lifts will not be serviced
as per Eskom standard standard of Eskom 240-75850027 “ The inspection ,testing,
maintenance of lifts and escalators and passenger conveyors standard” prescribes that the
highest degree about the inspection ,testing, maintenance of lifts are conducted in
accordance to relevant SANS standard ,and the OHSACT 85 of 1993 Lifts, Escalators and
passenger conveyor regulations.and this will have a major implication to the compliance of
the station on elevators and lifts.

column6:
Provision of Maintenance Repairs, Upgrade and Supply of
Spares on Otis Passenger Lift and Goods Lifts between
Unit 5 &6 for 36 months

extended from 25 May 2023 to 15 June 2023 to allow time for the tenderers to see the
revised price list, because the PPE, training and uniform costs were omitted from the
original price list and due to illness of the buyer because of the operation she had to do
during the tender evaluations.

column6:
Provision of Fire and Emergency Services at Komati
Power Station for a period of 24 months
column8:
Time extension and Funds request, The tender closing date for the new contract was
extended from 25 May 2023 to 15 June 2023 to allow time for the tenderers to see the

column6:
Coal stock yard dam dredging/desilting project for a period
of four months
column8:
The modification is as a result of the request from Environmental Department to increase
contract quantities due estimated quantities of the sludge that increased more than the
estimated 8000m3. The reason for this estimate was based on the previous quantities since
the dam could not be accessed as it was in operation. The contractor has since issued two
Early Warnings to Camden pertaining to the Quantities.

column6: Supply and delivery of granules
column8: Site requeste a 25KG instead of a 10KG that was delivered.

column6: Removal of Hazardous Waste
column8:
Original scope made provision for 64tons of sludge removal at Gourikwa, due to urgency
this was removed and Petro SA removed the waste. Sludge became again a hazard and
had to be removed, order was modified to include 64tons of sludge removal

column6: Rehabilitation of Tutuka Roads
column8:
This modification is for an increase in contract period with additional 4 months, cost increase
as a result of new additional scope as per the design provided by the Service provider for
east gate road works and time related cost that needs to be allocated due to time extension.

column6: Fire, Rescue & Emergency Medical Services
column8:
This modification is for an increase in contract period by additional 2 months and the
contract value by R483 000.00. The process of recruitment for eight permanent Emergency
Response team (to render fire, Rescue and Emergency Medical Services) and interviews
were conducted and completed. Lethabo needs the ER Services for the purpose of having
24/7 emergency response on site. The current services short term contract ends 30 June
2023. Human Resources Management is busy with documents verifications via
Remuneration and benefits and that process might take less than two- month hence we
request extension on current contract.

column6: Hiring of Cranes
column8:
This modification is for an increase the contract value by R301 497.00 from R693 891.00 to
R995 388.00 excluding Value Added Tax (VAT). The current order has run out of funds with
two months still left, due to a number of breakdowns we experienced inclusive of the
overhead bunkers, we currently have a breakdown on Unit 6 F Mill that requires a 190
tonnes crane. Also note that the 5-year contract will be presented at the Tender Committee
on the 1st of August 2023, thus the request for the modification.

column6:
Provision for maintenance, testing, inspection, and repair
of all cranes and lifting equipment at Matimba Power
Station
column8:
The funds that were allocated to sustain above services were depleted due to high number
of equipment’s failure rate and unplanned load test activities which involves funds

column6:
The provision of 24 hours service for Passenger and
goods lifts maintenance and supply spares at Matimba
Power Station (as and when required)
column8:
Funds are depleted due to unforseen breakdowns and the service is required to ensure
uninterrupted maintenance to ensure lifts availability and reliability

column6:
The supply and delivery of Submerged Scraper Conveyor
items for a period of 5 years for stock replenishment to be
used during normal maintenance and planned outage.
column8:
The initial forecasted quantities were depleted 11 months earlier than anticipated due to
forced outages as well as an abnormally high breakdowns that were incurred in this plant in
the last four years.There are three more Outages that are upcoming which will also require
these spares, and some of these spares have long lead times. It is for this reason we
request the contract to be modified by R10 292 349,24 to ensure security of supply of
electricity by ensuring we can procure these spares timeously during the remainder of the
contract.

226 planned start date as per rev 74 of the Koeberg Production Plan, i.e. 30 Sep 2023, falls
outside of the original/current contract term
